website_summaries.verdict: A nice, lightweight adult sleeping bag for camping in mild temperatures down to 40 degrees Fahrenheit. Ideal for those up to 6-feet 4-inches.
pros: Brushed polyester cover and Tricot fiber blend liner make bag soft and breathable
"Thermolock" draft tube helps prevent heat loss through the zipper on colder nights, and it unzips at the bottom to provide ventilation on warmer nights
Super comfortable and wide enough to turn on your side while sleeping
Very warm during a 30-degree sleep in the woods
cons: Straps for tying sleeping bag back up are poorly sewn into the seams on the bag
Included sleeve is hard to put sleeping back into
Flannel lining could be too clingy, scratchy, and uncomfortable for some
Inside cloth collects all the dry plant sticks and barbs

customer_reviews.title: I Fit Just Fine. 6'3" 270 lb Male. Easily Kept me warm during the night (40 degrees F)
customer_reviews.text: Me: 6'3" 270lbs Male Pros: I like the material. Rolled up easily. I fit within the sleeping bag. During use, I was warm and comfortable. It fell to about 40 degree F during the night and I was easily able to stay warm. Good zipper. The cord to keep the bag wrapped is good. Cons: None. since the cord is sowed in, I wonder if that will be the first to show ware. After first use, that might be awhile.
customer_reviews.author: David Ramos

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice sleeping bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sleeping bag for the price. I wish it was less bulky - doesn't compact well. It is roomy for 6'2". The quality of the stuff bag & the roll straps built in to the bag seem low - I doubt they'll last long term - but I can work around that. The zipper system is nice - 2 shoppers and the leading one has an anti jam feature. The two zippers lets you open the foot of the bag,which I appreciate.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: As expected - Great value
customer_reviews.text: Most sleeping bag temp ratings are more geared to survivability than comfort In my quest for a "50deg F." bag, I've bought several and survived, but woke several times at nite to put on socks or long johns I saw this Coleman Biscayne big and tall recently and tried it (I'm 6'2" - 190lbs and fit --- but I'm 70+ yrs old LOL) I've used various Coleman products since the 1950's {yea, I was 10yrs old) and can't recall any disappointment This bag is much more than just some material with a zipper, it's the real deal and may have to be unzipped depending on temp above 40-50deg I love it and will count on it Nice job, Coleman greg
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money but not as big or tall as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well-made sleeping bag. Both the outer shell and the inner lining are good quality, and it has a nice amount of padding to it. I can't speak to how warm it would be for camping because I am using it indoors as a floor mattress with two inexpensive egg-crate foam pads inside it. I do wish that the zipper locked. Also, it is listed as being 39x81, but the dimensions are actually 36x75. This actually works better for my purposes, but might be disappointing for a tall person.
customer_reviews.author: tealjoye

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy and best blanket I've used in a while!! (read)
customer_reviews.text: Do I need to start by saying, I use sleeping bags as bed comforters.... So as a blanket... This thing is freaking amazingly comfy!! Great build quality zippers seem strong and glide very well, the stitch is nice and the materials don't feel cheap like other bags I've felt.. aldo! amazing feel. I love Coleman bags as it is but this is definitely one of the best ones I've had yet *** I cannot speak to disability as I just started using it.. Update to follow if it doesn't last. But if no update then it's still going strong :}
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon

customer_reviews.title: Big bag and big value
customer_reviews.text: I do shift work for a bush airline in rural Alaska. This sleeping bag is my primary bedding when I'm in company housing. I love the size and it's pretty warm down to about 55 degrees or so. It's also very comfortable. * Update: this bag kept me warm when the heat in my room dropped down below 40 degrees F. I wasn't even zipped up in the bag and was using it as a giant bedspread. Very happy with this budget bag so far!
customer_reviews.author: AKokay

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight and much warmer than expected (or desired!)
customer_reviews.text: Love the no-snag zipper - works great and super smooth! The bag is roomy and the fabric is comfortable. Although this was advertised as a warm-weather bag, I tried it out on a 60 degree night and was sweating within 10 minutes. To be fair, I do cold fairly well, so I have a feeling this would be a good spring and fall bag for me, but not a warm-weather bag. Should work well for the average camper, though.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A.

customer_reviews.title: Best bag ever for a big boy.
customer_reviews.text: It is the largest, most comfortable sleeping bag I have ever slept in. I am 6'2" and 230# Not exactly a little guy. Lots of room to turn over, and nice to be able to pull it up over my head if I want. Originally felt the interior material was too "scratchy", but after a washing, it is just fine. Was so impressed and pleased with the price, quality and comfort, I bought 3 more.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Side-sleeper's dream!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a side sleeper, a wide-hipped woman, and I move around a fair amount at night, so a regular sleeping bag is way too confining. This extra-width Coleman bag is perfect for a comfortable night's sleep. The zippers are smooth & easy to zip. I really like that there is a "collar" of the soft interior fabric, so you don't have the poly exterior crinkling against your face & neck as you sleep. It was cozy warm during an late-spring trip of breezy low-50-degree nights, so I feel confident it would still be comfortable at least to 40 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable nice stitching, good bag for taller people, I am 6'5" it pulls up to my chin, very comfortable on ground and on air matress.Slept in it 1st night on ground inside tent, outer shell got wet, did not notice any moisture inside the bag at all.
customer_reviews.author: satisfied

customer_reviews.title: HUGE and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I am a guy who sleeps in a sleeping bag EVERY night, 365 days a year. If you are looking for a bag with: 1. A HUGE amount of room 2. A SOFT lining 3. A spot for your cell phone... This is a perfect choice. For the money, you can't go wrong. This is a bag for warmer times of year, and is really too large for backpacking... but if you are using it in the house, buy without worries!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fish

customer_reviews.title: Warm, cozy, big, but don't fool yourself into thinking you can roll it back up and place it back in the bag it comes with. lawlz
customer_reviews.text: It's big, it's warm, it's cozy. I'm 6'2" and this kept me warm when camping with my band. Taking away one star due to the tiny baggie it comes with that you fool yourself into thinking you'll be able to roll the sleeping bag up and fit it back in like it came. That's never the case (I've had a few sleeping bags from Coleman, and this is always an issue). I wish it was a slightly larger bag with a zipper. Don't let that deter you, it might just be that I'm inept at rolling up the sleeping bag. But, a bunch of us tried, and we all failed. The instructions also don't make much sense to me.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Chase

customer_reviews.title: Good value bag
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty warm for summer camping; I've taken it on two trips so far, one to the Georgia mountains, where it was actually a little too warm, and one to Wyoming, where it cools off a lot at night, and I was super comfortable there. My quibble with it is the lining, since I'm a pretty active sleeper, and between the grippy lining and the slick outer shell, the bag would go with me when I turned over, so the zipper ended up underneath me sometimes. Otherwise, a good bag--my husband is 6'2" and this bag was plenty long enough for him--and good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag!
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag, great value. Read allnthe reviews and was a bit skeptical due to the comments about the inner lining snagging on toe nails, rough skin, etc. I have experienced very little of that and certainly not to the degree I expected from the reviews. Did not want a bag with the cold nylon inside. Love the soft micro fiber/fleece inside. Perfect bag for inside or warm weather camping. Would definitely recommend and would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Steve LeonTop Contributor: Boxing

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bag itself is only 77x38 Inches long as supposed to the 81x39 it is advertised as. I don't like the lining. Very Cheap Material. The Sleeping Bag is warm and okay Quality for the price but I was not satisfied with the product overall.
customer_reviews.author: Nur Amatul-Aziz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Coleman value.
customer_reviews.text: Great value - lightweight for warmer weather. Actually bought this because we had no heat. Sacramento gets cold. I'm older and get cold easily. Put it on my bed. Small dog loves to climb inside and hide. This one is wide enough to hold two people or someone very large and tall. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: P. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Roomy and good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Needed a sleeping bag for our RV. This is roomy enough that you dont feel constricted. Construction and style is good. Will never in a million years get it back into the bag, so I purchase two bungie cords that work fine. It would be nice if the inside material was cotton vs synthetic but it doesn't bother us at all. Its perfect for our purposes. Good value for sure.
customer_reviews.author: LAX2012

customer_reviews.title: Returned because the inside is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sleeping bag and one that was slightly more expensive. This one was large, heavy, and the inside would stick to even the most pedicured and softest feet. Terrible fabric choice for the interior. I sent this one back and got the one that was about 10% more but about 100% better quality. Also, it is not very compressable. I can imagine using this ocassionaly for a kids sleepover but not at all ideal for any sort of camping.
customer_reviews.author: jimmy lee lefever

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for warm weather camping
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sleeping bag for warm weather camping and had the opportunity to use it at home when a flooring project prevented access to our bedroom for two evenings. It is LARGE - my 6'4" and 225# husband has plenty of room. The zipper is a great improvement from the Coleman sleeping bag purchased in 1982 in that the it no longer catches the fabric. The bag is too large to pack for motorcycle camping unless you pull a trailer or like a soft back rest. The liner is soft unless your skin is dry and scaly. Just lotion up before retiring!
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: If your a big person then this bag is for you.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'10 and 270 lbs and there's still plenty of room in it. The width is perfect you dont feel restricted. This bag is a whole lot better then the adult one I bought from wal-mart. (Update).....I just used it for 3 nights and it was great. Even though the temps were in the low 60s the sleeping bag was very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jk

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: I used this produCT for a week long trip in the Boundary Water Canoe Area in Northeast Minnesota. It worked well for the summer temperatures where the temp dropped to 55 to 60 degrees farenheit at night. This would probably work well for early fall temps there as well. The sleeping bag got a little wet one time from a sudden thunderstorm but still kept me warm. It also dried out quickly in the sun the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: TALL PEOPLE
customer_reviews.text: I am 6'7 230lbs and this sleeping bag is a perfect fit. Being almost 6'8 I can scooch all the way down till my feet hit the bottom of bag and completely enclose myself in this lengthy bag. Just took it camping and had to sleep in boxers every night I was so warm... BEST BAG FOR YOUR BUCK TALL PEOPLE!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: I like this bag, I’m 5’11 and this bag has plenty of room. I would not use it as a backpacker, but it’s perfect for using it in a camper. Inside is comfortable, all Around nice bag
customer_reviews.author: R_setnar

customer_reviews.title: Go for it if you need more space
customer_reviews.text: Am 6’ and wanted more space than the traditional bag. Not used yet but have tried it at home to make sure it is ok. Yes quite a bit more space than my older bag and will fit well on my oversized sleeping pad. Have tried the zip several times and it does not get caught in the material. Should provide more comfort without the restrictions of the trad sized bag.
customer_reviews.author: MikeC

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cool Weather Bag For Tall Folks
customer_reviews.text: This is a good bag for a six footer who finds most bags are too short. It will keep you warm in 60 degree weather if you sleep in your underwear or at 50 degrees if you sleep fully clothed, as many campers do. It might be okay at 40 degrees if you sleep in a sweater or jacket. It sells for a low price and is made for light use. This is not a bag for someone on a six week hike in the Rockies. It is more of a "April weekend at the cottage" bag.
customer_reviews.author: alanhouston

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable, wide and very warm
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable and wide enough to turn on your side while sleeping, very warm during a 30 degree sleep in the woods. One thing I didn't like it so much is the zipper sometimes not very easy to close near the end but that also might be related to the cold and damp weather I used this bag in, so still gets 5 stars.. highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: TheReviewerZ

customer_reviews.title: A nice bag, I wish it was as long as stated...
customer_reviews.text: Plus: A very comfortable lightweight bag at a very reasonable price. The inside lining feels very good on the skin. The insulation is evenly distributes and the sewing pattern appears designed to keep it in place. The zipper is smooth and easy to use from inside and outside the bag. Minus: Mine is only 78" long, not the 81" advertized. I'm 6'5" and bought this expecting the full length. I wish these manufacturers wouldn't play games with us with their specs. The included stuff sack is useless. No way I'll ever be able to compress the bag down enough to get it back in.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bau

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag but it's to small.
customer_reviews.text: Decent sleeping bag overall however, the description is incorrect. Both the description online and on the sleeping bag itself say 39x80. The the width of the bag is 35 inches. 4 inches smaller makes a hudge difference when your 6/1 and 220 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable lining
customer_reviews.text: The lining is "velcro" like and itchy. Grass and debris stick to it. Felt like I was working in an attic with fiberglass insulation. Avoid this and try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: I'm very satisfied with it
customer_reviews.text: My husband is 202cm height. But this sleepbag is still OK for him. I'm very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Iris

customer_reviews.title: I opened it it was packaged nicely. However I gave it a 3 stars because ...
customer_reviews.text: I opened it it was packaged nicely. However I gave it a 3 stars because the outside material was to thin. I bought this to replace my old sleeping bag. but the material seemed to cheap for me to keep it. I really love my old sleeping bag the material is thick and durable and definately keeps me warm in cold weather and is a true water proof sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: SoCalGal

customer_reviews.title: Will not keep you warm in cool weather but a great bag over all.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a set of these as my very first sleeping bags. Amazons delivery is excellent. I do have a gripe with Coleman though. I bought 2 of these, one came wonderfully packaged as NEW, the second one had been opened and someone had attempted to roll it up and put it back in the package unsuccessfully. It looked like a returned item.. Hope they didn't sleep in it then return it ....You get what I mean:( I like the feel of this bag but it could not keep me warm when the temp dropped. The two bags zipped together to make a queen size bag and the newer zipper design is so easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Cason

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: I work 24’s as a paramedic and use this sleeping bag every night at work. I haven’t had any problems with this bag. Zipper works great, easy to get in and out of. Material inside is soft. I’m not sure how long the cords that wrap around it when it’s rolled up will hold up, but they’ve been fine so far. Only con so far is that it has to be washed in a side load washer. For the money, I think it’s a great bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Every thing I hoped it would be! I wanted a lightweight, comfortable summer sleeping bag and that's what this is. The price is right for the quality and features. Read the description; that's exactly what you are going to get. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Gunn

customer_reviews.title: Good for up till autumn
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is a bit on the heavy side but I got it because it can fit a tall person easily. It's more pricey too because of that same reason. Good for up till autumn. Not good for winter. I keep it in the trunk of my car for emergency
customer_reviews.author: T. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Kept me nice and warm when it was 40 degrees. Very soft inside and the no snag zipper appears to work well. Of course I am unable to roll it back up so it fits in its bag but, I don't think I ever owned a sleeping bag I could. I will try again on a flat firm surface. Maybe
customer_reviews.author: rlt

customer_reviews.title: A real adult size sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.text: At 5’11” with a 46” chest I cannot zip most sleeping bags around me. This i can.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Fit my 6’5” husband well. Super light weight and the outside was soft. Inside—well I still wore socks because I hate that snagging feeling against my skin. It got down to 43 degrees while we were camping one night we wore extra layers but it did the job. No frost bite ;)
customer_reviews.author: Abschulzie

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! The only real downfall that I have ...
customer_reviews.text: It is near impossible to find a reasonably priced sleeping bag for anyone over 5'11'', but this bag accommodates perfectly. My boyfriend is 6'4" and this bag comes up to the tops of his shoulders... and lets be honest who really sleeps pin straight anyways. Great buy! The only real downfall that I have witnessed with this bag is that it is heavy and pretty much impossible to reconfigure into the shape that it was shipped in, luckily they added an additional zipper on the carrying bag to allow for extra room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: Love these sleeping bags I’m 6’2” every bit of 300+ pounds I fit in them no problem they are a bit warm so if using for summer months might be to warm. Great quality and very comfortable to sleep in. I ended up useing sleeping bag under body and poncho liner over me was to hot camping even though was 45-50 degrees. Great sleeping bag for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and comfy
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with the size and comfort. It breaths to allow for moisture control when it's a little too warm but warm enough down to about 40 deg. With a good milar mat maybe even cooler than that.
customer_reviews.author: chuck

customer_reviews.title: seems decent for cheap money
customer_reviews.text: so... its not 39" wide like people state here(learn to read a tape measure) ITS 37".. the inside is not slippery at all. bag will bind up if moving in it.. suggest turning inside out.. had i known people on here dont have the simple basic knowledge to read a tape measure i would not have bought it as i wanted a wider bag
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and decent quality, zipper on bag missing now though
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is super comfortable and seems to be of decent quality. The only complaint I have is that when I unzipped the compression zipper, the zipper came completely off and got lost in the grass near my tent. Looked for 30 minutes and still couldn't find it. So now, I've got the bag, but no zipper for it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian R.

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice bag. Comfortable and nice for adult. We used in mid 40 degree camping and it was fine. Definitely would not use in colder weather. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: MN

customer_reviews.title: Great! when I first got this sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Great! when I first got this sleeping bag, I had to run a lint roller over everything inside because there were the stuffing fibers everywhere. I woke up after the first use and my cloths looked like a snow man. After using the lint roller on it, it is clean and I haven't had any issues! I would suggest!
customer_reviews.author: Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Great Big and Tall intro price sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Finally a sleeping bag that fits my 6'1 240 husband without him feeling vacuum sealed. Got a thumbs up in a memorial weekend camping trip in east Texas, so think very hot and very humid and still comfortable. This series has the toggles to help hold the bag folded in half for rolling away and has a carry cover with handle
customer_reviews.author: Sona Graves

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Price for An Awesome Bag
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an affordable sleeping bag and bought this on a whim. It's perfect! My hubby, who's 6'3 and 220 fits in this comfortable. Im only 5'2 and adore this. It's warm and cozy. Love this ! and it rolls up in to a bag. Super compact and warm.
customer_reviews.author: JoyfromItaly

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag - durable
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought it as a hedge in case the power ever went out in my apartment in thw winter. When I taught overseas for several months, I took it with me. This is extremely well made, durable and I have not regretted a moment sleeping in it nor a dollar I spent on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jas. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Fits 6’4” young adult
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 6’4” son’s frat camp out. He said he fit fine which I was worried about and that it was lightweight enough for late spring in northern Texas without getting too hot in it. He did say if it had a bit more padding it would have been more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kcuret

customer_reviews.title: Would happily suggest this to anyone
customer_reviews.text: Big and roomy for sure! I’m 6 ft 3, 300 pds and I still have room in this thing to shift and roll over. Would happily suggest this to anyone. Only con is the roll up system and the bag. Boy that can take awhile to figure out and I would say I’m pretty capable of tackling anything. That one gave me a run for my money
customer_reviews.author: RodSny5867

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'5" and a very big guy, I bought this as a replacement for an older Coleman for a recent camping trip. It dropped unseasonably low and went down to 34 deg F over night and I was very warm and comfortable with no tent heater. I fit fine lengthwise with room to spare at the bottom. Highly recommend this for bigger husky guys like myself
customer_reviews.author: Chris Kleinert

customer_reviews.title: its roomy and warm
customer_reviews.text: perfect for what i bought it for, keeping warm in the winter here in floriduh. alos me to run the heat less. typcal coleman quality which is why i bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P. Yaw II

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: I use this as an extra blanket of my bed on really cold nights.It fits a full size mattress perfectly.Keeps me toasty warm.Very satisfied .
customer_reviews.author: Glock Doc

customer_reviews.title: Good lightweight sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these. Very nice lightweight sleeping bag for summer. Great size. Fit a 5"11 250lb guy perfect with room and a 5"9 300lb guy with ease. Will recommend these to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Holton

customer_reviews.title: Good for Dogs as well as people.......
customer_reviews.text: Friends: I bought this sleeping bag for a eight week old Chesapeake Bay retriever puppy due to arrive at our Ranch in the remote Sangre de Cristo mountain range of Colorado in mid September. While impervious to cold as an adult this breed of dog still will use this as his bed next to my own in the main Ranch house for his entire life. It can be easily be cleaned in a large washing machine. Google my name to Learn more....... Arthur von Boennighausen
customer_reviews.author: Arthur von Boennighausen

customer_reviews.title: Very warm and soft plus a carrying case!
customer_reviews.text: These sleeping bags are very, very warm. We went camping in them a few days ago and I stayed nice and toasty all night long. The inside is very soft and not itchy at all, and the outside is very silky. You could even unzip the sleeping bag and use it as a blanket if need be. The zippers are also strong, I felt no breeze coming through the zipper at all. They also roll up into a nice tight ball and you can put them into a strong but light enough carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda W

customer_reviews.title: Weak
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this sleeping bag for an emergency deployment (FEMA - hurricane Florence). The first time I picked the bag up the handle ripped. Unfortunately, I am unable to return the item... Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Water Brands

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and warm
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'6", but I like a large bag. It's very comfortable, but it seems more like a cold weather sleeping bag and not a warm weather one. It's very thick and bulky to be a warm weather sleeping back.
customer_reviews.author: Ed C

customer_reviews.title: Huge price increase
customer_reviews.text: Price went from $27 last year to $42 this year? I wanted to buy another to zip them together, bit it's not worth it at this new price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Love the length
customer_reviews.text: The length was perfect for a taller person to be able to snuggle into the bag instead of just covering up to the chest area.
customer_reviews.author: Bbrock01

customer_reviews.title: Nice n cozy
customer_reviews.text: Ah, this was the right one. I'm 6'2", and this is long enough for me. Not bad price for the quality. I don't use it much, but nice to know that its there when I decide I need a sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Fits a big guy well.
customer_reviews.text: I’m 6’4” 320. I have room! Kept me warm at 28F and was comfortable at 60F
customer_reviews.author: Nate Hoyle

customer_reviews.title: I have to admit this did a really good job in 40 degree weather
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit this did a really good job in 40 degree weather. For tall people your head sticks out the top a little. Can't go wrong. I was afraid i wouldn't like it because leople said your clothes gets stuck to it but it didn't bothee me at all and felt good on the skin.
customer_reviews.author: Mazon Zilla

customer_reviews.title: Decent Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty good. I like to cover my head a bit whenever I sleep with the blankets. I'm 5'11'' and this allows me to do that. The inside feels a bit "cheap" to me but then again it's not an expensive sleeping bag. I think it's decent though. Might get another to make it to almost a queen or full sized kind of bed.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Great for warm weather camping
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is very comfortable and works well in warmer weather climates. I switched to this bag because I camp primarily at the beach and needed something lighter. My only complaint is that the provided storage bag seems way too small. I also had to repair a 3 inch seam separation near the zipper after the first use. It was easy to sew as opposed to returning the item to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: D. Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Quality large mans sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: High quality and plenty of room. I am a bigger guy and it was perfect for the trip I needed it for. Very comfortable and warm .
customer_reviews.author: redeyesniper

customer_reviews.title: For 6’4” husband
customer_reviews.text: My husband is 6’4”, so I had to find sleeping bags that would fit his length. These were perfect! We bought two to zip them together to make one large sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: The height and width of this sleeping bag were exactly ...
customer_reviews.text: The height and width of this sleeping bag were exactly as I expected. However so were the reviews from others saying the material on the inside sticks to every tiny spot of dry skin . . If you don’t have socks and lotion on hand you’re in for a long uncomfortable night.
customer_reviews.author: jenn

customer_reviews.title: Roomy, comfortable sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.text: The other reviews are correct about the inner lining -- it's rather strange for a sleeping bag. But that doesn't hurt the sleeping experience. This bag is a worthy replacement for my Hollofil Coleman bag that I'd been using since the 1980's and that was getting so worn that I had to do some sewing to repair it almost every night. I'm 6' tall, and this bag is very roomy and comfortable. I use it on the floor in my house, with thermal underwear, with the heat turned down to 60.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Wright

customer_reviews.title: These bags are great. I used them for a week on a ...
customer_reviews.text: These bags are great. I used them for a week on a boat in the Pacific Northwest. I like the length (I am 6' 3"). The zipper works without snagging and you can zip two of them together easily.. My wife likes the warmth and the feel of the lining
customer_reviews.author: A Navy Vet

customer_reviews.title: Good Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: It arrived quickly and was as described by the seller. The quality is very good and price-point is reasonable. keeps me warm as expected, although not meant for freezing weather.
customer_reviews.author: Anson

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of Room
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is very warm and comfortable. My 6'4" husband had plenty of room when camping. I like that the inside is a cotton material. Seems like it will hold up to heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Dmtgrad

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these sleeping bags for camping. I ordered tall since we are 5'10 to 6'4. The sleeping bags are long enough, soft, great quality and easy to roll up and store.
customer_reviews.author: christinaw1168

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality!!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality.. I’m 5’10” and fit in this bag no problem.. It was purchased for my 10yo who spent almost a week camping in the backyard after we received this.. just to be able to use it..
customer_reviews.author: GoosesMother

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a truck driver and I got this for him to take in the truck. He loves it. It's roomy and comfortable, doesn't get too hot. Great price!
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: This was the first sleeping bag I've e-cert bought. I'm a big guy and this sleeping bag was perfect. I'm 5' 10"and was able to pull it over my head. It's super warm and comfortable. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: youngminiva

customer_reviews.title: Good sleeping bag, lousy stuff sack.
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bag is fine. Reasonably well made, good zipper. The stuff sack, however, borders on worthless. Pretty common problem. It takes two people and about 15 minutes of work to get it into the sack.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jester

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and roomy
customer_reviews.text: Two people can get into this sleeping bag. It is warm, easy to store,and very comfortable.Highly satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice color and feel
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband, he hasnt used it yet outdoors but likes this because of the color and feel.
customer_reviews.author: Candi D.

customer_reviews.title: Not a warm weather bag
customer_reviews.text: Not really a summer bag like advertised was way to hot for mild spring weather. Had a late season cold front come in and it worked great that night. On the heavy size for a backpacking trip but great for a family camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: This is the best summer/mid-season bag I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 boys in Scouts so we camp once a month no matter the weather. This is the best summer/mid-season bag I've owned. It's warm and above all, large enough that I can toss and turn in my tent and not feel like I'm in a straight jacket. Wish I would have bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: gregory n. cobb

customer_reviews.title: Not too hot and not too cold
customer_reviews.text: I put two together and used them on a bed in a fishing cabin. They kept me warm but not hot which was a fear I had when I bought them. Overall it turned out to b e good idea and a good product. I left them in the cabin so I didn't have to back them out.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Porter

customer_reviews.title: Sleepr
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my father in law for our camping trip. He really likes it and kept him very comfortable. He's a tall guy so I'm glad it worked out
customer_reviews.author: Kylo Ken

customer_reviews.title: Good bag!!
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag for larger people! Excellent quality, easy to zip, great price! I really like how you can put two of them together to make a double bag! But I’m not really a fan of the material on the inside, I didn’t like how it felt on my feet, but that’s just me.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable material
customer_reviews.text: Has excellent water resistance as I spilled a 24oz beer inside the sleeping bag and was able to soak it up before it could absorb into the material.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Nice big and comefey
customer_reviews.text: Nice warm, big sleeping bag. Doesn’t roll up as small as I’d hope, but it’s going to be nice to sleep in with my dog on trips.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton L.

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and big
customer_reviews.text: Fits 6’5” male fine. Only complaint is it’s hard to get back in the case/over. Might be easier to disassemble an ikea couch and get it back inside the box than to squeeze enough air out of this thing to get it in the case.
customer_reviews.author: Ainjylface

customer_reviews.title: Not your average sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Way better than your average sleeping bag, you can fully zipper it and still be comfortable. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: This is great. We ended up buying 2. We put the together and made a huge king size sleeping bag. Easy to wash and fold/roll back up
customer_reviews.author: 3r

customer_reviews.title: Happy with Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well. Good value . Got it for husband he is about 5’10” and 300 lbs . Had plenty of room .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful price and worth the money
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought it and needed something for wide shoulders very good quality and he loves it
customer_reviews.author: tammy

customer_reviews.title: Great large bag (not for backpacking)
customer_reviews.text: If you like your space when sleeping, this is an awesome bag. Can't imagine backpacking with it due to it's size though. I used it for a week long boating trip where it was a short walk from the boat to the camp sites. Temperatures at night where into the upper 40's to low 50's and this was bag plenty warm. I do like it cool when I sleep, so on nights when it was above 60, I did have to sleep with it unzipped.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I got this sleeping bag for a 5 day camping trip in desert conditions, and I don't think I could have found a better product. It was compact and light so it was easy to pack. It was roomy so I got to sleep comfortably even though I am the kind of sleeper who tosses about half the night. I liked that the inside fabric was different than the outside fabric. It's nice when the inside is soft and fuzzy instead of slippery. Makes the coldest part of the desert night snuggly and yet when it warmed up outside in the morning I didn't get too hot.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Being able to zip them together was great too, able to zip two together to go ...
customer_reviews.text: So warm, even when water got into the tent it never seeped into the sleeping bag. Being able to zip them together was great too, able to zip two together to go over a queen size mattress.
customer_reviews.author: jolynnemichelle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for big and tall men!
customer_reviews.text: just what my husband needed, has plenty of room and is light weight!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: By far my favorite camping purchase
customer_reviews.text: So comfy. By far my favorite camping purchase. I'm 5'9" and like to spread out a little when I sleep and this kept me warm but free from confinement all night. Can't vouch for low temperature ranges as it was a warm summer night.
customer_reviews.author: likebooks

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag, very fluffy and warm with the extra height I need as a tall guy, but still compact and portable. Worked great for a chilly October campout in upstate New York. One word of caution: if you get the idea in your head that this is big enough for you and another to share if you snuggle up close, it just isn't. You need two, zipped together.
customer_reviews.author: Snakeman Commander

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for 50s-60s F nights
customer_reviews.text: I got this bag along with the Coleman Oak Point Large Cool-Weather Sleeping Bag to zip together into a double sleeping bag -- which works great without any problems and makes a HUGE double bag that extends over the edges of a queen sized blow up mattress. I used this bag on top when the weather was around 58F at night and was nice and comfortable (I sleep very cold). I figure if the temperature gets down to the lower 50s, I could put the other one on top.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: I weigh 205 and shoulder to shoulder is a bit snug,Length is fine as I am 5’10”.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t care for the slippery outside and wish that I had bought a larger bag.My fault and it will be ok for camping but I use it on my bed and my blankets on top keep sliding off.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Fiorillo Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Happy Camper!
customer_reviews.text: Kept me cozy and warm! Great for tenting it! So soft and comfortable. Love the option to attach two together. Awesome buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jane

product_meta.title: Coleman Sleeping Bag | 40°F Big and Tall Sleeping Bag | Biscayne Sleeping Bag
feature_bullets: Lightweight adult sleeping bag for camping in mild temperatures as low as 40 degree Fahrenheit
Big and tall design can accommodate most people up to 6 feet 4 inches tall
Brushed polyester cover and tricot fiber blend liner provide softness and breathability
ZipPlow system plows away fabric to prevent snagging during zipping
Roll Control design and Quick Cord system for easy rolling and securing
